icom.description: identity, description, organisation, location, environment and capability of each potential support provider of relevance to a product group

icom.name: product group
icom.description: set of products, operated by one or more customers, that are to be addressed by a specific support solution definition

icom.name: product group usage profile
icom.description: expected pattern of usage and life constraints applicable to a product group requiring support

icom.name: resource item description
icom.description: identification and description of the resource items expected to be available at each location to support a product group

icom.name: support opportunity
icom.description: identification and description of an actual opportunity, or a type of opportunity, when work could be performed on a product needing support

icom.name: life or usage parameter
icom.description: name, definition and representation options of a parameter used to define product usage or set limits on product life

icom.name: operating environment
icom.description: description of an environment in which a product may be required to operate, from the viewpoint of its likely impact on the requirement for support

icom.name: identified support location
icom.description: identification and description of an intended location or geographical area where support may be required or provided

icom.name: local support environment
icom.description: definition of relevant environmental conditions at an identified location which could affect the provision of support and hence the support solution
icom.note: Such environments can include artic or desert conditions, or the use of a covered dock.

icom.name: support location capability
icom.description: ability of one or more support organizations at a given location, to undertake classes of tasks within a support solution definition

icom.name: elicited support need
icom.description: potential requirement on the design of the support solution, reflecting the desires and expectations of a recognized stakeholder

icom.name: feedback on support needs
icom.description: requests for further information to assist conflict resolution between requirements

icom.name: list of stakeholders
icom.description: set of stakeholders identified by life cycle directives

icom.name: recognized stakeholder
icom.description: person or organisation with a legitimate role in the specification, design, commissioning or use of a support solution definition

icom.name: requirement directive
icom.description: information derived from the life cycle directives, expressed as a potential requirement for a support solution definition

icom.name: agreed support need
icom.description: support need accepted as suitable for inclusion in a support solution requirement

icom.name: quantified support metric
icom.description: performance measure, with target value, to be used for assessing the performance of the support solution definition
icom.note: This includes specification of the performance measure in terms of agreed characteristics, and the quantification of target or threshold values for use when assessing support achievement. Quantification may be expressed in terms of any agreed characteristic including cost, availability, time or rate of resource use.

icom.name: support characteristic
icom.description: quantifiable parameter used to define an aspect of support system performance

icom.name: support characteristic clarification request
icom.description: requests to stakeholder seeking clarification of required support characteristics

icom.name: support metric clarification request
icom.description: request for clarification of a support metric proposed by a stakeholder

icom.name: unresolved support conflict
icom.description: notification of a problem identified during support solution development or use, which cannot be resolved without breaching support solution requirements or constraints

icom.name: product behaviour
icom.description: expected behaviour of a product for support purposes defined in terms of operating and fault states, expected values of measurable parameters, and relationship of symptoms to possible and probable causes

icom.name: request for task evolution
icom.description: invitation to further develop a task specification

icom.name: safety or support critical issue
icom.description: request for action by the life cycle owner, or an expression of concern, arising from identification of support drivers that affect safety or other topics of critical significance to the delivery of viable support

icom.name: support driver
icom.description: requirements for support activity, linked to the source from which they arose

icom.name: unresolved support driver
icom.description: support driver for which no effective response can be found
icom.note: Unresolved support drivers can arise because support task opportunities are not technically feasible or economically viable within the support engineering programme constraints and the support solution requirement.

icom.name: potential task
icom.description: name, identifier and description of a possible support task

icom.name: task applicability
icom.description: classification of a task based on its relevance to a PIF, a product group, a product version, a location or support opportunity type
icom.note: Task applicability criteria may be extended or changed when the task is selected for use within a specific support solution definition.

icom.name: task description
icom.description: definition of a method for performing a potential support task
icom.note: The task description may include definition and quantification of the resources required to perform the task.

icom.name: task resource model
icom.description: algorithm or formula for calculating the likely task duration and resource use when the task is executed
icom.note: Human resources are included so that a task resource model could predict the time required to perform a task by staff with specified skill levels.

icom.name: request for support item
icom.description: request for the design or supply of a new or additional resource item required by a task, or for information on the feasibility and cost of obtaining these
icom.note: This request may also communicate formal requirements and specifications for the design, modification or acquisition of new or critical support items, and could also be used to request information on support cost and lead time for products beyond the PIF scope which have relevance to the support of the PIF.

icom.name: request to embed
icom.description: request for action to assess the feasibility of changing the product to improve supportability, or to embed support capabilities within the design
icom.note: Such a request can result from requirements to improve reliability, maintainability, redundancy, durability, sustainability or product life. Requests to embed can seek to incorporate capability within the product for prognostics, diagnostics, condition monitoring, built in test, safety or environmental protection that is needed for support reasons.

icom.name: task resources
icom.description: identification and quantification of the resources that are needed to perform an individual task
icom.note: This may include definition of required skills and experience of required support personnel.

icom.name: necessary task
icom.description: name and identifier of a task that is applicable to a given support solution definition

icom.name: relevant support driver
icom.description: support driver of relevance to a specific deployment environment and support concept

icom.name: request for support concept change
icom.description: request for a change to the support concept

icom.name: support plan
icom.description: identification of the tasks required to support a product within a specified deployment environment, including the logic through which tasks are combined or otherwise related
icom.note: A support plan can include a presentation of a typical maintenance programme for a product needing support. It can also specify non-maintenance tasks, such as activities required to provide and prepare required resources. Some necessary tasks can never be implemented if the conditions under which they would fall due fail to arise. This can include a task to correct a rare fault state.

icom.name: support plan option
icom.description: possible support plan, corresponding to a specific support policy

icom.name: support policy *
icom.description: statement defining the approach to be taken when developing a support solution definition for a specific context
icom.note: This could include a requirement to apply a reliability centred maintenance approach.

icom.name: task procedure
icom.description: step-by-step instructions for undertaking a necessary activity in a form suitable for use by the support provider
icom.note: The same task may be supported by several task procedures, each tailored to the needs of a class of users, with different skill levels or to alternative task methods.

icom.name: rationalization proposal
icom.description: proposal to change the assignment of tasks to products, or the task trigger conditions, to achieve rationalization of work packages within the support plan

icom.name: task to product relationship
icom.description: relationship between a necessary task and the product element, or elements to which it applies

icom.name: task trigger
icom.description: conditions that require a task to be done, in the context of its assignment to a specific product element within a support solution definition

icom.name: predicted downtime
icom.description: forecast loss of operational time due to support activities during the operating period in question

icom.name: predicted product state & usage
icom.description: forecast state and usage of the product after a period of operation, defined in terms that are meaningful to the task triggers, including predictions of anticipated faults

icom.name: predicted resource consumption
icom.description: forecast of the resources needed to support a product during a specified period of operation

icom.name: required tasks
icom.description: tasks expected to be performed during the operating period of interest

icom.name: assessment deficiency
icom.description: issue from analysis of assessment results which may require change to the assessment strategy

icom.name: assessment strategy
icom.description: strategy for assessing and validating the support solution definition, and the support engineering programme, against agreed objectives and metrics

icom.name: assessment strategy issue
icom.description: issue that may require a change to the assessment strategy

icom.name: inadequate source
icom.description: request for a change to the assessment strategy, arising because available information collection mechanisms cannot provide the required feedback

icom.name: commissioning feedback
icom.description: information on the progress of commissioning activities against the plan or recommendations for change to the support solution, the product, or the commissioning schedule, arising from commissioning experience

icom.name: commissioning objective
icom.description: objective to be achieved by the commissioning activity
icom.note: The objective may address any phase of the commissioning process including acquisition, construction, testing or certification of support system elements

icom.name: commissioning schedule
icom.description: schedule showing the intended timing and sequencing of intended commissioning tasks
icom.note: Commissioning tasks are those required to create the support system.

icom.name: commissioning task feedback
icom.description: information on the progress, resource consumption and issues arising from performing commissioning tasks
icom.note: Information provided to identify trends or potential problems from applying a commissioning solution.

icom.name: commissioning task metrics
icom.description: measures of performance applicable to the performance of commissioning tasks

icom.name: first use date
icom.description: date when a support element is required for first operational use
icom.note: The first use date is used to establish the schedule of commissioning activities.

icom.name: support system release
icom.description: confirmation that the support system is in place and ready to accept products needing support

icom.name: transaction replies
icom.description: responses to transaction requests, providing details of price, availability, delivery or forecast availability of requested resources

icom.name: transaction request
icom.description: request for the provision of one or more required resources at a specified location and date, or hastening a previous transaction request
icom.note: Transaction requests arise from the need to supply resources to support work at a specific support opportunity, or to position resources with a support system.

icom.name: commissioning programme logic
icom.description: logical constraints and relationships applicable to intended commissioning activities

icom.name: scheduling problem report
icom.description: information on issues that prevent successful completion of the commissioning schedule
icom.note: Such information can identify tasks that cannot be scheduled due to constraints from resource availability, operational schedule, or other reasons.

icom.name: selected commissioning task
icom.description: activity required in the commissioning schedule to establish a viable support system, capable of applying a support solution definition

icom.name: assured support solution
icom.description: support solution definition that is authorized for use in providing support or disposal to one or more product or support element

icom.name: authorised task
icom.description: task on which work may begin

icom.name: disposed element
icom.description: element of the product, or its support system leaving the control of the life cycle owner

icom.name: information to system operator *
icom.description: information provided to the user or operator of a product needing support regarding the condition of the supported product

icom.name: maintenance need
icom.description: work request identifying additional support tasks which may be needed to restore products to serviceable conditions

icom.name: operator feedback *
icom.description: information provided to support authorities by operators including information on product health and usage, and equipment problems discovered by operators
icom.note: Such feedback can include trouble reports, log books and other data from on-board recording systems, passed to support authorities for analysis. The operator feedback is structured to conform to the information management rules by activity A4.4 and is communicated within this model by the support feedback arrow.

icom.name: product needing support
icom.description: one or more realized products that require support
icom.note: Such products include any realized element of the PIF. These elements The include embedded information of relevance to support activities. This information can take the form of stamped on serial numbers, bar codes, embedded chips, log books or other media carried with the product itself.

icom.name: product status
icom.description: notification of the current state of a product receiving support, as confirmed by the authority controlling the work

icom.name: required resources
icom.description: identification of the resources needed to support scheduled work at one or more support opportunities

icom.name: standard commercial transaction set
icom.description: set of standardized business transactions that execute requests for the provision of resources, and provide responses on their expected delivery

icom.name: support element
icom.description: physical item required to sustain product capability

icom.name: support schedule
icom.description: systematic plan or arrangement for performing one or more support tasks
icom.note: The status of the schedule may change as it develops. The support schedule may include a maintenance schedule defining work to be performed on the product needing support. A support schedule may also define tasks applicable to support elements or required resources such as the calibration of a test instrument.

icom.name: supported product
icom.description: realized product that is available to the life cycle owner for operational use

icom.name: task feedback *
icom.description: information, in any form, derived from observation of a realized activity including progress, findings or resource use, prior to the capture of this information in the format required by the information management rules

icom.name: work status
icom.description: information on the progress of activities in relation to a support schedule
icom.note: This information on status is transient and will change as the work progresses.

icom.name: request for schedule revision
icom.description: request for revisions to the support schedule as a result of feedback from task execution
icom.note: This may include reports of deferred tasks or requests for additional activities that should be considered for inclusion in a subsequent revision of a support schedule.

icom.name: selected support provider
icom.description: organization, or organizations, selected to perform scheduled tasks

icom.name: support opportunity objectives
icom.description: objectives applicable to a specific support opportunity

icom.name: task logic
icom.description: logical sequence of the intended activities, reflecting the constraints which apply

icom.name: task to schedule
icom.description: activity to be included in the work schedule for a given support opportunity

icom.name: commissioning task
icom.description: activity to create, test or validate an element of the support system
icom.note: This includes activities to establish resource items in appropriate locations and work to bring support infrastructure to a state fit to receive a product needing support.

icom.name: consequential task
icom.description: activity that needs to be included in a schedule as a consequence of another task
icom.note: May include additional tasks required by the proposed activity logic or by resource preparation requirements such as the work needed to set up and calibrate a test rig.

icom.name: individual product state
icom.description: expected configuration and condition of an individual product at the start of the support opportunity
icom.note: This information may be available from the APSI and related information.

icom.name: other task
icom.description: identification of a task to be scheduled that has not arisen directly from the application support solution or commissioning schedule
icom.note: Such tasks can include change tasks, outstanding tasks from previous work, exceptional tasks required by the life cycle owner, or tasks required to meet support opportunity objectives.

icom.name: task to determine product state
icom.description: activity required to establish the configuration or condition of a product prior to receiving support

icom.name: triggered task
icom.description: activity which the assured support solution definition declares to be necessary based on evaluation of the task trigger condition

icom.name: completed task
icom.description: record of successful completion of a task required by a support schedule

icom.name: product history
icom.description: information of the product usage and condition over a period in the past, derived from support feedback records

icom.name: product related feedback
icom.description: information on the state of the product or support element on which a work is underway collected by observation
icom.note: This may include information about the product configuration, product status and product condition such as test results, wear measurements and information derived from embedded support capabilities.

icom.name: product release report
icom.description: information confirming that a realized product, having received support, is now ready for use

icom.name: task history
icom.description: information of previous work done on a product needing, or receiving, support derived from support feedback records

icom.name: task related feedback
icom.description: information on the progress and status of a realized activity, including resource use
icom.note: This may include information on the person performing the task, task steps completed, man hours used, start time, elapsed time, spares, tools or consumables used.

icom.name: configuration record
icom.description: record of the configuration of a realized product
icom.note: Records of configuration status may be required following incorporation of a configuration change, the removal of a serialized item, the replacement of a serialized item or the performance of a configuration audit task.

icom.name: product status record
icom.description: observations, measured characteristics or a record of the state of a product needing support
icom.note: The state of a product can include the existence of fault, an operational state or a status in relation to recognized steps or stages of a support process such as awaiting test or ready for dispatch.

icom.name: product usage record
icom.description: information of the past use of an operational product
icom.note: Product use can be quantified against any usage parameter in any pre-defined operational or usage state such as product life, number of landings or hours spent above 50% power. Product use records can be contained in, or extracted from, log-books or electronic records, such as tapes or discs, as provided by product operators or other personnel.

icom.name: resource usage record
icom.description: information on the past use of a resource in the course of performing one or more support tasks
icom.note: Resource usage includes the consumption of spares or consumables, time spent by human resources in performing support tasks and the usage of support locations or facilities. Usage may also be measured by other parameters such as elapsed time, number of starts or cycles of operation.

icom.name: support element status record
icom.description: observations on the condition, measured property or status of a support element which has been, or is being used, as a resource for a task

icom.name: support issue
icom.description: request for action to resolve, or an expression of concern about, a problem arising from working on a product needing support
icom.note: This may include requests to modify the product or support solution definition.

icom.name: support task record
icom.description: information on the state of a current or completed activity, including reports of completion of individual task steps

icom.name: product integrity exception
icom.description: identification of product conditions not recognized or addressed by the support solution that require analysis and direction
icom.note: The absence of a response to such exceptions may prevent release of the product to service. The existence of product integrity exceptions may lead to an extension of planned work or of the support solution definition.

icom.name: suggestion for improvement
icom.description: proposed improvements the support solution definition or the PIF
icom.note: Such suggestions can include a change request or proposed alteration to the information management rules.

icom.name: support task exception
icom.description: anomaly between a realized activity and its related task specification
icom.note: Anomalies may occur in the task instructions or the resources used and may lead to issues or changes affecting the product or support solution definition.

icom.name: information technology service or infrastructure
icom.description: information technology capability able to provide timely, convenient and effective access to all participants in support activities for entering and reading information
icom.note: The activities defined in the model could be performed without this resource but the model was designed to reflect the use of a shared, and integrated, data environment by all participants.

icom.name: support infrastructure
icom.description: fixed physical assets required to provide support
icom.note: Fixed infrastructure within a support system, such as docks, workshops, runways, or test beds, is treated in this activity model as a tunnelled mechanism to relevant activities. Mobile support elements, such as people, parts, tools, and mobile support equipment, are treated as an input or resource to the relevant activity. The ARM in this part of ISO 10303 treats both of the above as resource items. Support schedules are assumed to address all required resources.

icom.name: APSI update
icom.description: proposal for correcting the APSI to reflect findings from verification or audit activities

icom.name: audit issue
icom.description: issue arising from configuration audit and verification feedback

icom.name: configuration management plan *
icom.description: document that specifies how configuration management is to be accomplished for the product in focus
icom.note: The CMP provides details of the processes, schedules and associated toolset for performing Configuration Management including resources and skills. Activities required to develop the CMP are beyond the scope of this activity model. Further information on configuration management can be found in ISO 10007.

icom.name: issue requiring change action
icom.description: issue that, following assessment, is deemed to be worthy of subsequent change action

icom.name: rejected issue
icom.description: recorded issue that has been rejected following assessment, possibly including the reasons for rejection

icom.name: rejected request for change
icom.description: request for change that has not been accepted

icom.name: request for impact report relating to issue
icom.description: request for assessment of the potential impact of an issue which may lead to a valid need for change

icom.name: request for other action
icom.description: request for action that is not part of a change, arising from a documented problem
icom.note: May include request for additional information to support change action, or the deferral of change action to a later date

icom.name: variance
icom.description: departure from the design intent as specified by the APSI

icom.name: impact report on an issue
icom.description: report on the potential impact of an issue providing an input to a decision on whether to proceed with a change

icom.name: issue
icom.description: question, concern or proposal related to Configuration Management

icom.name: recorded issue
icom.description: work request or expression of concern that has been documented and identified

icom.name: change priority
icom.description: priority which has been assigned in accordance with information management rules or local business rules to enable adequate subsequent processing

icom.name: documented problem
icom.description: change opportunity or identified problem to which a change priority has been assigned

icom.name: request to identify & prioritize change
icom.description: invitation to allocate a change identity and priority following assessment of a documented problem
icom.note: This request may lead a valid need for change, after appropriate analysis.

icom.name: request to redefine problem
icom.description: invitation for action to better define a document problem
